SEARCH
Package risk.common.persistence

Klasse FilePersistenceManager

java.lang.Object
risk.common.persistence.FilePersistenceManager
Alle implementierten Schnittstellen:
PersistenceManager
public class FilePersistenceManager extends Object implements PersistenceManager
Manages file persistence for players and their states in the game.

This class provides functionality to save and load player data to and from files. It supports operations such as saving a list of players to a file and loading players from a file. The class is designed to handle the serialization and deserialization of player objects, ensuring data integrity and ease of data manipulation.

  • Methodendetails

    • speicherPlayer

      public boolean speicherPlayer(List<Player> players, String filename)
      Saves a list of Player objects to a file.

      This method iterates over a list of players, converting each player to a string representation and writing it to the specified file. Each player's data is separated by a newline followed by "---" for readability. If the operation is successful, it returns true; otherwise, it returns false if an I/O exception occurs.

      Angegeben von:
      speicherPlayer in Schnittstelle PersistenceManager
      Parameter:
      players - The list of Player objects to be saved.
      filename - The name of the file where the players' data will be saved.
      Gibt zurück:
      true if the players were successfully saved, false otherwise.

    • loadPlayers

      public List<Player> loadPlayers(String fileName) throws IOException
      Loads players from a specified file and returns a list of Player objects.

      This method reads player data from a file, where each player's information is expected to be in a specific format. It processes each line of the file, creating Player objects and setting their attributes based on the parsed data. The method handles the parsing of player attributes, including name, ID, color, number of units, number of countries, mission card, and alive status. It also processes the countries associated with each player, setting their attributes and adding them to the respective player's list of countries.

      The expected format for a player's data starts with "Player{name=", followed by the player's attributes and the countries they own. Each player's data is separated by a newline, and each attribute within a player's data is separated by commas. The method ensures that each player and their associated countries are correctly instantiated and added to the list of players to be returned.

      Angegeben von:
      loadPlayers in Schnittstelle PersistenceManager
      Parameter:
      fileName - The name of the file from which to load the players.
      Gibt zurück:
      A list of Player objects loaded from the file, with their attributes and associated countries properly set.
      Löst aus:
      IOException - If an I/O error occurs while reading from the file.
